cons: There are inconsistencies in the level of management and co-workers in both training and standards that can make difficulties worsen and hard days lengthen. May ask too much for a salary pay in terms of hours.

title: ‘Understanding and supportive workplace’
pros: Gaining an insiders understanding of a large business, having supportive coworkers and managers, discounts, improving my social skills, discovering new products, feeling secure in my position.
cons: Dealing with difficult customers, occasionally dealing with potentially dangerous situations, lots of multitasking, unpredictable shifts

title: ‘Awesome environment to learn and grow as a person.’
pros: Regular opportunities to work with new people and learn new tasks and information. I like how the job involves a great amount of customer interaction and allows me to develop my personal communication skills. It is a great first job and I am gaining a lot of experience in dealing with customers and working independently.
cons: I find obtaining shifts a challenge. I struggle to get more than one shift a week and they are only 3 to 4 hours each. I also sometimes find working independently at a register a challenge, but it gives me a chance to learn and grow as a person as I can't rely on others in every situation.

title: ‘Nightfill is not for me, but the friendships certainly were’
pros: Coles has a fantastic team environment. From team huddles at the start of each shift to positive encouragement from supervisors, I always felt supported and enjoyed making friends in my team. It was also great to feel part of such a huge company as Coles.
cons: Nightfill can be challenging in terms of the shifts - new team members were put on Thursday/Friday/Saturday nights, which was restrictive in terms of social life and very tiring. After I moved to casual, my main struggle was the isolation of nightfill. Despite having a great team, you often work by yourself for hours in an aisle. Some people really enjoy solitary work, but not me.

title: ‘PAY PEOPLE WHAT THEY ARE WORTH.  Staff should be paid in accordance to their effort, loyalty and reliability, not just by the time they clock in and out.  There are many that work their hours and many that bludge their hours.’
pros: Most times the hours are flexible.  I enjoy most of the colleagues that I work with and it is mostly a social and friendly environment when things are going well.
cons: I am one of a very few that are constantly called upon to pick up the pieces and cover for the other slackers and people that are constantly letting the team down and rarely get any recognition for our effort and hard work.  There is a lot of unnecessary pressure put on a few reliable individuals who slog away when a lot of the slackers seem cruise along without a worry in the world.

title: ‘Will not work in supermarkets. Will not recommend anyone. If get chance will work in management-level’
pros: Coles discount card which they gave it to you when you join Coles. That's the only thing which is good because you get fuel and goods discount.
cons: So many challenges. You will not get many shifts and in starting you will only get maximum 4 hr shifts and they play smartly with you. They offer permanent part-time so max 20 hrs but they made you work 4-5 days for 4 hrs only and you will not get any shifts on the weekend because it is penalty rates.

title: ‘Four years and going strong.’
pros: It's a great company to work for. There is plenty of potential for people to advance their careers while not having to give their personal lives away. They are very understanding of everyone life outside of work, whether it's personal commitments or study.
cons: I enjoy the challenge of how much/how well I can pack bags. A personal challenge for me is dealing with communication. Working with coles has definitely helped bring me out of my shell and deal with my anxiety a little more.

title: ‘Enjoyed my time very much working with the staff and having the chance to work in different areas and also wish I was back working there’
pros: Worked with a great team of people. Were very understanding with any situations.
cons: Making sure that we got the nightfill load onto the shelves in time for the customers the next day so that there was no extra workload for the day staff

title: ‘I would recommend Coles to work at especially for the young ones starting out.’
pros: Help, support and training.  Management always easy to approach and advise on anything.  Other team members were great to work with.
cons: I was working at Coles as a second casual job so juggling two jobs would be a challenge with the times of my shifts.  Unfortunately I don't work there anymore as I was offered a part time role at my other job.

title: ‘Fun team atmosphere with all the highs and lows of customer service’
pros: Good team members. Flexible hours. Don't take work home. Professional payroll department.
cons: Tight staff allowances for rosters. Can lead to upset customers which obviously makes the job harder.

title: ‘Looking for alternative employment ’
pros: Shift work able to play lawn bowls
cons:
No support for management leading up to Easter 
No support on Friday and Saturday’s with increased production. Other stores with similar or less production have extra staff.

title: ‘Good for a short term position ’
pros:
The company itself is good to work for
It's a somewhat easy job to do 
 Team member discounts and deals
cons:
My personal store was a nightmare 
Management wasn't great , as well as the way things were run
Get ready to be called in whenever and work silly hours regardless of your situation 
Physically straining

title: ‘Great work place and pay, however poor quality equipment can become dangerous’
pros: Good pay, good co-workers, good boss, good flexibility for shifts
cons: Damaged equipment, not enough hours, made many casuals go part time and anyone who couldn't got less shifts, repeatedly changed location of products confusing us and customers, not many perks

title: ‘I miss working at Coles, I would recommend it to anyone, I'm still friends with co-workers from 15 years ago!’
pros: Co-workers were great. My set hours suited me very well (I wish I could get them again.... Or even just be hired again now that I really need it!). I believe my wage may have been slightly above the award wage, it was a long time ago but I remember being happy with my wage.
cons: The only difficulty I had was when I did the opening of the store for a while.... It was hard getting out of bed at 4am to open the store at 5:30 but I got used to it. That's the only \"challenge\" I can think of hahaha

title: ‘Overall, it was a good company to work for.’
pros: Some flexiblilty with rosters. Team member discount at all Coles Group stores. Job security. Opportunity to earn penalty rates for public holidays and overtime. Awards for exceeding customer service expectations.
cons: Some of the procedures to be followed aren't efficient in a real store environment. Budget cuts mean everyone is trained for more than one department, so that when it gets busy you can fall behind on your own work while helping out in another part of the store. Limited opportunity for advancement.

title: ‘My experience working in retail.  I had an overall good experience working at Coles. The people I worked with were very helpful when you get stuck. As a team we worked very well together.’
pros: I like the fact that we were always busy. You were always guaranteed shifts each week.
cons: I would comment that the Support management were a bit out of touch of how the daily running of the store were manage.

title: ‘Building a great career’
pros: You can get trained in other departments of your choice and make your way up to certain level. Coles also offers retail leaders program where you can simply exprience different levels of management work within Coles Supermarkets. You can also apply for a 12-month Graduate Program where you learn how to a great leader in the future for Coles.
cons:
Willingness to work and work hard are two most important keys. You have to show your manager that you can face any challenges they give you and you did well!
No matter how difficult the challenges are, don't give up - you'll see you'll make it happen sooner or later to build your own career.

title: ‘Very bad’
pros: The worst company I have ever worked for, I’m glad I only stayed for 6 months
cons: Literally everything especially the budget strip down, it has everyone stressing out, no work life balance and very poor management

title: ‘Terrible, don't put yourself through it unless ur desperate’
pros: Have met some amazing life long friends.
cons: Everything, management don't care about anyone but themselves, if it doesn't suit them, it doesn't happen. You can be one of the best workers there but if you do one thing wrong, prepare to be turned against. Far too quick to point out wrong doings and never praise good workers. In turn all of the good workers are leaving and they still can't seem to figure out why, absolutely useless.

title: ‘Expect burnout and poor management support.’
pros: Good office environment, opportunities to move around
cons: Unclear strategy and poor leadership. Say one thing but do another. Works store support center employees to the bone. Poor with load management - some people have it really easy while others drown in work. Poor processed and unclear accountabilities.

title: ‘I was working in IT, and the approach is very old school and people not willing to innovate.’
pros: There are some good people, and people are helpful
cons: There has been lot of outsourcing, people who stay there over 10 years is just waiting for package. people who working only a few years are just worry about job security.

title: ‘\"To all store staff and Coles Services\" was what was written on the Christmas Party notice...take from that what one team means :)’
pros: Coles services is like a separate thing entirely since the one team mantra barely extends to them. Good thing about that is the team is more internally focused and driven to produce results for our Team Leader opposed to the overall store managers as they barely interact with the service staff beyond the bare minimum or telling them to clean something that technically isn't our department or area to clean.
cons: Time off around peak trade is difficult and Annual and Sick Leave times were blocked out and monitored heavily with maximum amounts set in place etc

title: ‘I love working at Coles as part of the coles services team. It’s and a challenging and enthusiastic position with a great career pathway opportunities.’
pros: The environment and people
cons: There are various types of challenges that arise within this department. However meeting and overcoming these hurdles are what we as a team at coles are made for.

title: ‘Competetive and fun environment to be a part of’
pros: Flexible hours, great support network, challenging and rewarding environment working with KPI's and budgets, plenty of oppertunity to grow and learn.
cons: High paced environment that is rewarding yet challenging when hour cuts have left a lot of us working alone so multitasking skills are essential in this business. Bonuses are slow to be paid

title: ‘All in all I didn't mind working with Coles Services and enjoyed working everyone there. The job while sometimes boring was nonetheless okay. Only left because of a lack hours and being able to find another job.’
pros: The staff were always nice and very helpful  both within Coles Services and Coles Supermarkets. The job itself was pretty easy and I enjoyed being able to work unsupervised.
cons: Very little hours which results in very little money. I probably would have stayed longer if I was given more then twelve hours a week. Also not having a manager to report to other then via phone was sometimes annoying.
location: Bateau Bay, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Great workers and people who put in the hard yards get noticed and rewarded with leadership roles. ’
pros: Team members choose their availability
cons: Casual and part time team members rarely get more than 15 hours per week. Its hard as there are so many rules restricting what you can work. Working most weekends and terrible training plans.

title: ‘Tightening of budgets,cutting of hours & poor store management are the reasons I left employment earlier than planned.  I did not feel valued after 22 years of service & was disappointed in the way team theft was handled at storel level’
pros: A good manager can make all the difference to team morale. Great teamwork that is recognised helps you feel valued
cons: Overall Coles streamlining tasks means that staff are stretched too thinly, and work satisfaction & customer service suffers.

title: ‘Awful.’
pros: The employees were great to talk to during lunch breaks.
cons: The management, for the most part, were awful they make it so blatant that they don't care about you and have to realistic expectations. Not only was I stressed out about being able to complete jobs given to me (mind numbing \"facing\") but I was also made to look after a special needs kid to make sure he did his job too, pretty much doing his job for him.

title: ‘It was a good first job to learn a lot of new things.’
pros: The management were able to work around my social life. They were always nice to me. Other employees were able to help fill shifts in time of need.
cons: Personal friendships sometimes got in the road of a work relationship. Lots of talking behind peoples backs. Constant change in managements meant it was hard for employees to trust higher up abilities.

title: ‘Challenging, fun but sometimes struggling and days when you want to give up’
job_title: Deli Assistant But Also Trained In Checkout, Bakery, Fresh Produce And Grocery/Night Fill
pros:
Overall good company to work for
Some good and supporrtive managers
cons:
A lot of people who are not management think they are
A lot of gossiping goes on
Reduced hours due to coles services
Having to wait 8 years to go part time whilst others who worked there less time were granted part time hours before me

title: ‘Positive place to work’
pros: The friends I made with my fellow team members, it was relatively well managed and organised. It was fun, busy and a positive place to work
cons: Bad or rude customers and getting abused.

title: ‘Mangement could be bias to their friends sometimes in some stores while some stores are best to work with.’
pros: Flexibilty around working hours when I had to study. Part time work are quite handy.
cons: Getting enough hours to make a living out of it. Variable hours. Late night work. Sudden call to work. Management can be worst sometimes.

title: ‘Good job whilst studying, average job overall.’
pros: Other team members, flexibility to work available hours and great benefits.
cons: Management, miscommunication between lower level staff and higher level management, stifled opportunities, no emotional support from management.

title: ‘Good place to work where you will be appreciated if you do a good job based on high workloads in time contraint situations.’
pros: Appreciated when you do a good job. Helping customers during your shifts.
cons: Time constraints with workloads. The need to ensure you keep OH&S as a premium focus. Work type is hard on your back and legs.
location: Batemans Bay, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Staff are mostly good to work with, but the management culture especially at higher levels is very poor, so called HR experts at job prospect workshops also seem to not have a clue.’
pros: Most of the staff are good to work with
cons: Dealing with poor management at all levels within the company and the company culture

title: ‘Enjoyable’
pros: Great job, so many goals and awards you can achieve always a happy environment, good hours and pay for young and older generation
cons: There are a lot to name but here are some, great customer service, community hero they also participate in relay for life, it's a great experience

title: ‘Fortunate that my self esteem remains intact’
pros: Convenient. In a management position Coles teaches you how to manage a business properly. Valuable lessons learnt in relation to rostering,profit/loss and stocktaking.
cons: Senior management attitude is disgraceful with little support given. Unreasonable demand on personal time.

title: ‘Coles is a great way to start your career!’
pros: I only work casually at Coles as I study full time, therefore it is a great job that works around my timetable. The pay is also reasonable and there is always a Coles around the corner so you do not have to travel far.
cons: It tends to get hard always working weekends especially when we all have social lives, though working weekends is essential in the retail industry.
location: Edensor Park, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Rewarding but sometimes challenging’
pros:
Everyone works as a team. Hours are shared out, and when people need time off as long as there is enough notice leave is given.
As someone who is a casual I would highly recommend coles to my friends as a part time job.
cons: Sometimes customers are quite rude. It is up to us to not take it personally and sometimes this is quite difficult.

title: ‘Pay is good and group discounts also there.’
pros: Equal opportunity for all the employees  and good job security compared to other companies.
cons: Hard to go ahead with positions because of the competition.

title:
‘5 years with coles nothing change
only changes hopeless grocery manager night fill hours are   hours 4 hours 7pm to 11pm 
coles cut midnight shift 

because after 11pm 
 penalty rates ’
pros: 10% discount at christmas
cons: Getting load done

title: ‘It was a good base to start a retail while at high school and university.’
pros:
Flexible work hours for students and weekend work.
Good way to develop retail and customer service skills.
Variety in the work you can do with the different departments within the store.
cons:
Constantly dropping hours due to management wanting to increase profits.
Less people working around you, ie checkout staff making the job more stressful.
Unrealistic expectations for work supposed to be completed in each shift.
Culture of higher management.

title: ‘I've been at Coles for over 12 years now :)’
pros:
The opportunity to advance is pretty good within the coles family, If you are willing to put in the time and effort.
The pay is good too.
cons: Communication is sometimes lacking, but overall it's not to bad. I think the biggest challenges are learning to bite your tongue when customers are rude.

title: ‘Try Coles if you're in your teens and want to a good customer service foundation.’
job_title: Team Member - General Merch Department And Mix Apparell
pros: It's a great place if you're a beginner in the workforce. Whether you're stacking shelves or a \"checkout chick\", it does give a good foundation as to how customer service works which you can then take to other jobs.
cons: You do have to deal with customers on a daily basis - obvious but should be remembered. Sometimes if you're young when you start out (like me) this can be daunting, especially when they're not happy. It's also hard when you're young if your management team only see you as another \"young worker\" and not a valued employee, which was how I felt.

title: ‘Biggest mistake of my career!’
pros: Good team mates. That’s it.
cons: It is not the big happy company like the way it seems from the outside! Double standards. Management lazy and on massive ego/power trips get little help, training and little support limited amount of team on so constantly short staffed and over worked. Management don’t care about staff and have too high expectations! They don’t listen to feedback or ideas as the coles way rules above all else!

title: ‘Working with Coles has so far proved to be so much more fun than sitting around on the dole. :)’
pros:
Supportive team environment. 
Clean and safe. 
Stable and reliable hours.
cons: Sometimes the expectations (work load) can be a little too much, but as long as you're trying your best to be a little better every day, Coles is the place for you.
location: Wagga Wagga, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Good employer for casual or part-time work’
pros: I worked in fresh produce which had its own team separate from groceries etc. The supervisor was friendly and made sure we knew what we were doing.
cons: The longer shifts tended to drag quite a lot because all the work in restocking displays etc and cleaning front and back of house would be finished fairly early on.

title: ‘Mind numbing and over worked with a penny pinching company’
pros: Nothing to say as there is not a lot of good thing to say about coles there only interest is how much they can strip wages and make it imposible to cover the work load
cons: Impossible to achieve the work load in the hours given.and on some occasions you don't get lunch or afternoon tea

title: ‘Challenging, but rewarding when assisting customers results in a great outcome and experience for everyone.’
pros: Having a great team to work with and know that I am supported.
cons: Juggling high volume customer peak times with providing excellent customer service.
location: Aspley, Queensland, Australia and Gatton, Queensland, Australia

title: ‘The positives out weigh the negatives.’
pros: Stability of being with a big company,diverse personalities amongst team members,fresh fruit supplied in lunch room.
cons: Physically demanding.

title: ‘Very stressful and draining place to work.’
pros: The customers and relationships you form with them. And also your work mates they become like family.
cons: Politics, management worry more about the people who do wrong then appreciating the good loyal employees

title: ‘Great opportunities and salary but you work hard for it.’
pros: Learn good management foundations, fast paced, good salary, good support.
cons: Can be stressful, long hours, hard work, reluctance to move up due to demand on work/life balance.

title: ‘Rewarding’
pros: Working with great people. Meeting alot of different people through customers and learning a lot of new things as well as new skills
cons: Working in a fast paced environment and very physicAl work

title: ‘If you don’t care about the hours you get then go for it otherwise if you want the hours go somewhere else! ’
pros: The local customers and that’s all.
cons: There wasn’t really any because sometimes you don’t get told anything.

title: ‘Depressing ’
pros: The only good thing about working at Coles is it is convenient with small children to work nightfill if tou can survive on lack of sleep
cons: Working with management

title: ‘The Coles Life’
pros:
Different departments across the store to work in.
Something different everyday.
Great staff discount
cons:
Can become repetitive. 
Long days standing in one spot if on checkouts.
Can have some late night shifts.

title: ‘A great 7 years working my way from the lowest position to one of the highest at store level, good people and a good workplace.’
pros: Plenty of development opportunities.
cons: As a salary team member is was required to work long hours.

title: ‘I would go back should the opportunity arise.’
pros: Training is to high standards. Certificates available for leadership and salary is pretty impressive for the job.
cons: Management is long hours and can impact family life.

title: ‘Used to be a great place to work for. Wouldn't recommend it as a long term job anymore.’
pros: Majority of fellow team are very interesting. working with the customer is what makes the job worthwhile.
cons: Very customer focused but not so much on team members well being. Though they make it look like it on the surface when it comes down to it, it doesn't matter on what is right for the team member as long as the shareholders and customers are happy.

title: ‘Coles has given me the benefit of excelling in my career development, my self confidence and a great way of developing myself far beyond what i thought i was capable of’
pros: The acceptance and the chance to move forward and different areas you can develop in different departments
cons: You will face busy challenges but the rewards far out way the the negatives

title: ‘The hours expected are 10-12 minimum a day. Not worth being a service manager!’
pros:
Discount card is 5% 
There are opportunities to move on to higher management if you work hard.
cons: The supermarket is not always safe. Customers can get aggressive and say whatever they want. There isn't always security and you are expected to prevent theft consistently. Major Responsibilities are to save money from wages budget and provide service. How?

title: ‘An overall positive experience with occasional difficulties with customers or management.’
pros: I enjoyed the people the work there as most of them are friendly and easy to get along with and I also liked the size of the store because it wasn't too big which made it easier to get around or find an item for a customer.
cons: Sometimes the customers were hard to negotiate with however this is inevitable in any supermarket and most of the time the customer would come around. Contacting my boss sometimes became difficult as well for various reasons and this was inconvenient especially if I couldn't work.

title: ‘Unless you are desperate, don't do it. If you are desperate, you'll need a thick skin and not get too angry.’
pros: If you can get into a good group of people and know some managers, you can always get hours due to staff not wanting to work.
cons: You can be terrible at your job and no one will do anything about it. You can be great at your job, but you won't get recognition. I try to engage with other team members in other departments, but I am ignored most of the time. Be prepared to face this if you are somewhat introverted. Be an extrovert and you might find a small clique you can interact with. Process changes often and you are not given clear instructions or information. Everyone passes off jobs to others and does not follow up.

title: ‘Love working as part of a team, just wish remuneration would catch up with the effort put in.’
pros: Has a real family type feel.
cons: DM's not paid enough for the work and hours put in. Especially as they are expected to work weekends and public holidays. Work life balance is hard to maintain as a DM.

title: ‘Steer clear from Coles’
pros: Fairly flexible when it comes to rostering around time available.
cons: Communication is terrible and higher management seems to not care about the feedback given to them by the department leaders. No matter how much the department heads cry out for help within their department, the store managers and higher ups seem to not care at all and expect the departments to work better without any changes being made

title: ‘Loved working for Coles for 10 years until Poor direction and support from line manager forced me to make the decision to leave ,best thing i have done leaving’
pros: Opportunities to advance  was rapid but training and support was varied depending on support from your line Manager
cons: No work life balance ,too tired to enjoy the Money i was earning ,inconsistent communications ,fear management ,made to feel like you had to stay longer hours to support the business .

title: ‘Great starting point for other careers in the customer service industry ’
pros: Ongoing training, making long lasting friendships. Great for uni students as hours are short and can be flexible
cons: Not having enough support from senior/store manager, no feedback on job well done only criticism where it’s not deserved

title: ‘Really loved the time I worked with them.’
pros: I had a great time with Coles Services. The management and staff were very helpful and easy going. The hours were good. Maintenance on the equipment was done within 24 hour time frame. Enjoyed my stay there.
cons: The equipment was a challenge when breakdowns happened. It was tough but you just work your way through the problems.  Time frame for some tasks were a challenge however,  all was completed within the time frame given.

title: ‘Decent job to get you through uni, don't expect career progression. ’
pros: Always busy, flexible with university commitments and great customers.
cons: Top-down management and low-level employees have no voice despite surveys which encourage honest feedback. Only way to move up is to get chummy with the manager as individual hard work goes unrecognised.

title: ‘Mentally and physically exhausting. ’
pros: The people you meet.
cons: Everything. Overworked. 12+ hours a day with minimal breaks. Bad regionals and support. Old fashioned managers with old mindsets and old fashioned managing. Huge workloads with minimal staff allowed.

title: ‘A little better everyday , when us enough.’
pros: Good mob of really hard working individuals, very good line manager , giid set of visions , principles, and procedures but
cons: Shifting goal posts, unrealistic expectations , poor communication, sometimes conflicting, no succession planning Too many people with their fingers in the pie , behind the scenes changing expectations and goals/ focus.

title: ‘Coles as a stepping stone too the workforce.’
pros: Coles provides fexibility and good work environment. It's the perfect stepping stone for a young employee too enter the work force.
cons: Learning to deal with customers in a professional manner when things don't go to plan is important challenge to over come. Maintaining professional protocol throughout tasks is also a challenge but is a very beneficial skill to have.

title: ‘Great team environment but lack of opportunity.’
job_title: Team Member Of The Meat Department
pros: Great team members, great customers, good pay, good music.
cons: Busy Sundays and Public Holidays. Reaching sale targets and putting out as much stock as you can within a limited time frame.

title: ‘My experience at coles has been great so far,ive met pleanty of friends and gotten along with people i maybe didnt like in the first place. I love working at coles.’
pros: I love working at coles because I just love the environment, everyone is so so nice and we et discounts!! its just great.
cons: Angry customers.. other then that its easy !
location: Bonnells Bay, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Wish I never applied. Wasted 7 years. Pure misery.’
pros: If you like working 80 hour weeks but being paid for forty hours go work as a Coles manager. If you want to be treated as a number with no regard for your health and wellbeing go work at coles
cons: No work life balance. No compassion to your personal circumstances
location: Port Stephens, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Another stepping stone’
pros: Decent pay but in my experience management tend to play the favourites game with their casual staff hours where there isn't much equality. Customers are good to serve when they have a personality and good manners. Good team to work with.
cons: You will get a few unhappy customers from time to time where they will challenge you. Stick to what you know and it won't be a challenge resolving any issues.

title: ‘Everyone should work here - so they'll be motivated to do better’
pros: This truly is an inspiring job. Working at such a terrible place gave me the push I needed to return to academia and try and better myself. Nothing can break through self-doubt and prompt the bettering of oneself like the mantra: 'Don't worry, if this doesn't work you can always go back to Coles.'
cons: Management. Avoid if at all possible.

title: ‘Very rewarding and best management’
pros: Amazing management team! They are super flexible with shifts and so kind, welcoming and generous - I was sick during one shift and two of my managers drove me and my car home! what a beautiful gesture. I meet so many cool customers, such a diverse environment
cons: Occasionally not enough shifts for a casual, however normally works well with me as I'm in grade 12. Heaps of shifts during christmas tho!

title: ‘It's horrible and very stressful ’
pros: Maybe staff discounts if you actually get your card
cons: Shifts were cut to 3 hours and pay was very little and management asks you to do stuff that is physically impossible in 3 hours like clean the Deli,bakery,do all Bins, fresh produce, sometimes 2 chicken ovens with 14+ racks and the floor gets messy right after

title: ‘Ok until i was pregnant than i was dej’
pros: The team members
cons:
Don't work there if your pregnant or trying to return after birth.
Management especially foriegn management are useless. As a 2ic I had to train my manager and she got all the benefits and perks.

title: ‘Challenging but fun and rewarding’
pros: Most managers were very understanding and had worked their way up so knew what each position entailed.
cons: Working in such a large group of people it was hard to get noticed for a career opportunity and once you finish schooling career opportunities  are what you are looking for.

title: ‘Avoid it, if you want to keep your sanity.’
pros: The pay is slightly higher then a lot of places. The friends you make, you all end up bonding over your hatred of the place or you go out and have fun to forget that you work there in the first. On people's anniversary so of working, SOME stores hold little morning teas, free lunch is always a plus.
cons: You receive no appreciation for the work you put in. Management looks down on you and tends to keep to their own little cliques. Think of it as being back in highschool, where everyone is broken off into their own cliques and the school principal has it in for all the teachers, so the teachers just stop caring about the students. The students in turn hate it so much that they either stay there being miserable in hopes of progressing or would rather leave and do nothing with their lives. There is no trust between managers and staff. They act like they care but the moment things might not be going so well for them, they place all the blame on you even if you did nothing wrong. It exhausts you to the point of being emotionally dead inside.

title: ‘I would work there again in the future if there was an opportunity.’
pros: Working at Coles Norwood was good because all the staff were friendly with each other and it was easy to fit in there. The pay was pretty good for a casual job and they were flexible with hours.
cons: Open most days, so didn't get many weekends or public holidays off.

title: ‘Stable job and have always felt supported and listened to.’
pros: Have always been understanding and flexible in giving me the hours I need while studying and working around my other commitments. Friendly team to work with and always helping each other to get things done.
cons: I can't really recall any major problems over my four years of working there.

title: ‘Been working at Coles for 8 years and I have hated at least 7 of them’
pros: The people you meet working at Coles are like family (I have worked at 3 stores and this is consistently true!) also like the diversity in jobs, you're always moving
cons: Career progression is insanely competitive. Getting full time is pretty much impossible unless you are in management (which is unlikely for most people, unfortunately). I understand that managers have managers too, but the ones in store are always ruthless, cutting hours. Also if you work more than your contracted hours, you dont get paid

title: ‘I  have left Coles management and wont be going back’
pros: Coles gave me very quick opportunities to move forward into higher roles. Through the management team you can easily gain footing in a department managers role even with 0 training.
cons: Management team has a very high expectation of your work output. Even with as little management experience as 2 months I was expected to complete all tasks effectively and complete overtime hours without pay. With very minimal training or advice you are expected to achieve results and targets that are not even explained to you. Along with this i never received a management salary even after 6 months of management work. I had to chase people around to get the money i deserved as all they look for is ways to save money.

title: ‘Working with coles is hectic.’
pros: When you work at retail it gives you oppoutunity  to interect with different people. Thats probably the best thing to work in retail.
cons: They put too much on you day in and day out.

title: ‘I've stayed too long and recent changes have not improved things.’
pros: Not alot of good anymore. Once upon a time it was really great but now not so much. Hourly rates have froze and/ or dropped for new staff members. The bottom line is more important than people.
cons: Fulfilling job tasks in unrealistic time schedules.

title: ‘Best company to work for they care about the team their families and the customers.’
pros: Always rom for growth within the company and as there is so many stores in Australia you are pretty much guaranteed a job anywhere.
cons: Working your way up to prove you are a god worker and then a new manager comes so you have to start again

title: ‘Both challenging and rewarding on a developmental level .’
pros: Suited to enhancing customer-service skills and an opportunity to fulfil communication and self-governed leadership roles.
cons: Call-in requests were often too frequent, meaning work life and personal life became interchangeable . Often , phone calls were several times throughout a day and when rejected , left a feeling of unfulfiment in the worker.

title: ‘Good for a job, not career.’
pros: Decent pay rate for an entry level job. Team was amazing to work with. Reasonably flexible working hours.
cons:
Very high turnover rate of staff and management. Very big lack of communication within management levels.
Very little opportunities to work up in ranks due to graduate program taking priority over Emerging Leaders program.

title: ‘Coles is good for young people at school, but that’s about it. ’
pros: At least at Coles you high pay for weekends and public holidays
cons: The overall pay isn’t great, and it isn’t a friendly environment to work in, also there is very little chance of being able to up skill yourself.

title: ‘Management need better training & need to stop hiring when they are in off peek & give more hours to the casual workers, also pay up for work place accidents instead of cutting hours’
pros: Staff discount, when busy full week work 38 hours
cons: The challenges are trying to get proper hours which mostly end up being 1 or 2 times a week

title: ‘A fantastic opportunity.’
pros: Fantastic large company which pays well and has lots of opportunities. Fantastic atmosphere in the building.
cons: Most areas are complicated despite push for simplicity.

title: ‘Overeducated, overskilled and unappreciated.’
pros: The team members working together through adversity is good. The Store Support person does what she can to lift morale. The pay rate is better than other retailers.
cons: The changes to policies and expectations are frustrating. The greed is overshadowing the corporate citizenship and the employees are suffering. Once was proud to work there but now feel just like a resource.

title: ‘Good’
pros: I enjoy the variety of customers i meet a day, the learning of new skills and developing more confidence in myself and my job everyday.
cons: The challenges are learning how to deal with hard customers and learning how to work in different departments quickly.

title: ‘I am glad that I become part of Coles Revesby Family and  I'm improvong my cusyomer service skills.’
pros: They are supportive, helpful, friendly and respectful. They practice good team work environment and equal employment opportunity. This is like a family environment and I love working with the team. I experienced good company of people like my own family.
cons: To meet the day to day deadlines. The management was changed very often so you need to adapt the new system of new manager. To faced different type of people or multicultural environment, personality of individual within the organisation.

title: ‘A great place to work with a great bunch of people with a great hourly rate.’
pros: Great people, good management and great opportunities! The job can be rewarding by ensuring customers are satisfied with their experience within the store.
cons: Trying to balance everything in a shift. It can become quite hectic trying to serve customers and helping customers with enquiries, however with patience and understanding as well as a smile on your face you can achieve it!

title: ‘Would like to still be working for the company, but not at the same store.’
pros: Excellent pay, stores are across Australia so it's easy to transfer.
cons: Some managers are more difficult than others, and unless you're in the Union they can more or less do what they want.

title: ‘Positive in first few months and since feel ignored and unappreciated can't wait to get a new job due to this!’
pros: Get paid, staff discount
cons: No support from management to advance my career no matter how many times I've asked for help and wanted to be trained in other departments where I know I'm much happier to work. Would be of benefit to the company to use people in departments they want to be in rather than for example putting someone in bakery just because it suits the hours they want to work.
location: Woy Woy, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Decent place for a short time.’
pros: The discount card and the basic team members are always friendly to one another.
cons: Working within the management. Managers at my store shifted often and it was very difficult to enjoy working, always fun when you have to argue with a manager to get a day off for a funeral.

title: ‘I would not be where I am today without the opportunity that Coles Supermarkets gave me.’
pros: If you are willing to work hard and have the talent, the opportunities will come. Coles have very good standards and it is one area that I am fanatical about.
cons: The work - life balance can be challenging at times. To have the right team around you is very important, including your line manager.

title: ‘A nice enough place to work.’
pros: They're an employer that makes your earnings feel very stable and secure. Other team members are, generally speaking, very nice and helpful.
cons: Management are under a lot of pressure to meet targets and budget expectations. This makes them more susceptible to being ruder to the team members.

title: ‘They owned me. I would never go back’
pros: Ummmmmm....... I’m struggling to think of anything. Perhaps the discounts at other retailers.
cons: Minimal hours allocated for a large quantity of tasks. Unrealistic expectations and I was a dept manager.

title: ‘The work was okay, but the organisational structure and treatment of staff wasn't.’
pros: The work was decent, what you would expect.
cons: Never got a roster on time. Sometimes getting the roster for the week half way through it. Management at times would expect far more than was capable.

title: ‘Mind numbing and frustrating.’
pros: Working with good people and a 5% discount that some years the make 10% around Christmas, but sometimes you just get a free yogurt.
cons: In my store, Altona, there is high store manager rotation. Essentially this means you either have prospective managers at their first store or terrible managers at their last store.

title: ‘Great first job if you have the right attitude - relatively good pay and security of shifts and generally flexibility. But definitely not a long term career if you're on nightfill as it's physically demanding and a lot of people I know are suffering from ’
job_title: Casual Night Filler In Grocery Department
pros: Above award wages and security of hours if you worked hard. Being in night fill meant I could study during the day and work at night.
cons: Time demands - efficiency was the most important thing (obviously, in such a big chain store) so a lot of the times I wouldn't get all my breaks, I would push myself physically the whole shift which affected other aspects of my life. It was difficult to take safety precautions when there was so much work to be done and I always felt like no matter how hard I worked we would never get the load put away.

title: ‘I enjoyed the people I worked with, but not the actual running of the store’
pros: The two discount cards went really well in helping out the family groceries
cons: I was expected to work over time without the compensating pay and this I felt was unfair due to the small shifts I was given and the expectations of work I was expected to complete

title: ‘Good job to start working life’
pros: Opportunities for career development, understanding of disability issues on the part of management, flexibility with hours
cons: Some older stores in need of renovation causing issues for staff in those stores, personality clashes among staff, change of rules sometimes without informing relevant staff

title: ‘Not rewarding, but not challenging either.’
pros: A casual work environment. Not overly challenging, if you like that sort of thing.
cons: Most lower level employees are treated as disposable by supervisors and lower management. Not much respect is given, despite the hard work done by cashiers and floor staff.

title: ‘The best job I have ever had’
pros: The people I work with are so happy and my managers always appreciate the work that I do. I get treated with respect and everyone that I work with gets treated as equals.
cons: Dealing with difficult customers.

title: ‘Loved working here’
pros: Recognition for your effort.  Opportunity to climb the ladder.  Friendly and helpful environment.  Great environment to work in.  Clean and safe. Full training.
cons: Making target sales. Irate customers, more so in this industry as it involves peoples money. A target risk for robbery.

title: ‘Hands down the worst company you could ever work for. ’
pros: The only good thing about working at coles was the occasional 8hr shift I got every once in a blue moon
cons:
Waking up and getting out of bed to go to a job that you KNOW cares more about saving their own selves money than having employees that are taken care of and an reasonably distributed workload.
Oh, and also dealing with managers who are on a power trip.

title: ‘Enlightening’
pros: Very flexible and understanding for me with my family commitments - club sports and weekly training.  Bakery Manager and Store Manager were super supportive of my cake decorating skills and creative flair.
cons: Other colleagues gossiping, jealousy and undermining  my work.

title: ‘Good foot back into the work force’
pros: Work independently in a team environment, team members who genuinely care about your wellbeing and get praised when things get done ✅
cons: Working on your own in busy periods can be a real headache

title: ‘It was probably one of the best jobs i have had i thoroughly enjoyed my time there.’
pros: Multiple job opportunities, room to improve and progress
cons: Physical, mental, conversating and dealing with customers \"something I wasn't all that used to\"

title: ‘Hard job and bad management , training inedaquate , job description is not clear’
pros: Team members are diverse and helpful with each other
cons: Meeting goals, \"the concept of one rule or standards for every store, yet most stores are different in size, complexity\"

title: ‘Typical big company’
pros: Variety of hours to work
cons: Feeling like a number is the worst thing, never thanked but always told when something is wrong.

title: ‘Rewarding though life consuming’
pros: Great development opportunities
cons: Work life balance working in store around the clock

title: ‘Loved my job and enjoyed working with some really nice people’
pros: Great bunch of people to work with.
cons: Been trying to get a transfer for the past 3 months without success.

title: ‘Coles is like a second family’
pros: The good pay for the work that you do
cons: Some people don't pull their wait in work

title: ‘Would work there again’
pros: Decent pay and hours
cons: Dealing with shift trading and transferring

title: ‘Coles is a good place to start your career’
pros:
Staff discount
Clean environment
Good wages
cons:
Not getting enough hours sometimes
Working in areas that you dont like

title: ‘Great place to work if work is your only priority in life’
pros: Fun and vibrant environment
cons: Poor culture and work life balance

title: ‘Worth it’
pros: How easy the managers relate and support you through work and through personal issues.
cons: When the store managers don't want to hire more people, it's stressful trying to replace shifts and finding personal time when needed
location: Woy Woy, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Fun’
pros: Happy and friendly environment.
cons: Availability of shifts.. There wasn't many shifts available...

title: ‘Excellent’
pros: Working unsupervised and working with great team mates
cons: The hours. Starting at midnight took a while to get used to.

title: ‘Great covidence and rewarding role’
pros:
Great people to work with
Discount benifits at westfatmers
cons: Having to be helpful and happy to the customers

title: ‘Great team ,great experience and a great community company that want the consumer to have a grea experience’
pros: Supportive management
cons: To deliver great customer service

title: ‘If I could be somewhere else I would’
pros: There are good people working there
cons: Using being in retail as an excuse for poor leadership

title: ‘Alway looking for other work as not happy’
pros: Team is friendly and customers are great
cons: No work life balance,  and a lot of favoritism going on

title: ‘Worst company I have ever worked for in 35 years of my working life’
pros: Made me more motivated to get a better job
cons: Rubish hours changed all the time to suit there shape - Nocompasion for family life

title: ‘It has been a challenging experiece’
pros: Oppurtunities, if there is a good management
cons: You can be thrown in to the deep end anytime.

title: ‘Overall pretty great job’
pros: Great staff to work with and they make the job fun and the time generally went really quickly.
cons: Management was always a struggle with. Managing my life around work was always difficult as I would get called in all the time.

title: ‘Great starter.’
pros: Good people, got to meet new people on the registers
cons: Lifting heavy things

title: ‘It was very rewarding working in customer service.’
pros: Positive team members
cons: No training which was very challenging.

title: ‘The older you get the less shifts you are given.’
pros: Great place to develop great skills in the service industry
cons: Management was challenging as it was hard to compromise with most of them

title: ‘Not enough hours for everyone’
pros: Big company so you get paid on time.
cons: Too many staff for new store opening, then not enough hours for everyone.

title: ‘Great team and good organisation to work for’
pros: Great work environment
cons: Not many options for lunch (compared to the CBD!)

title: ‘Rewarding’
pros: Great pay, flexible hours and excellent people to work with.
cons: Most managers need more training on leadership but there are a good few out there.

title: ‘I had a fantastic experience 99% of the time.’
job_title: Front End Cashier, And Front End Supervisor.
pros: Room for improvement, some of the managers were fantastic. flexible. Able to transfer to another store with ease.
cons: Working till midnight but not finishing until 12.15 or later and not getting paid the extra.

title: ‘Don't get too worked up while working here.’
pros: Lovely crew to work with at any store.
cons: Work load during peak periods as compared to manning provided.

title: ‘Do right by Coles and you won't have a problem’
pros: Flexible hours and being able to work different departments
cons: Placing orders can be a challenge and lifting heavy boxes

title: ‘A fair place to work. ’
pros: Staff discount makes a difference.
cons: Commuting can be tiring.

title: ‘I started on the register, and made it to Personnel Manager and stayed there for 25 years’
pros: Management treat you fair
cons: There is always a challenge to the top , with management thereto help you.

title: ‘Generally good’
pros: Dynamic environment
cons: The marketing team at that time

title: ‘Well maintained work inviroment & loads of free online courses’
pros: Work mates
cons: Pressure

title: ‘Micro Managed Business no Leadership’
pros: The people support each other even if management dont
cons: Lack of Leadership, everything micro managed, unrealistic expectations

title: ‘A good experience, but very understaffed.’
pros: The environment was good, with great colleagues etc.
cons: The store i worked at was very understaffed.

title: ‘They give younger people all the hours.’
pros: The people who work there are nice and its easy to get time off if you need it.
cons: The job itself is pretty easy but register training was limited so your kinda thrown into the deep end. And you cannot survice on hours provided, they give all the hours to the youngest employees and most shifts are just under 4 hours so they dont have to give you a 15min paid break.

title: ‘It was a job, sometimes good, sometimes not so good’
pros: My manager was lovely and all the supervisors were great
cons: Sometimes had a bad manager and that made work difficult

title: ‘The negatives out weight the positives’
pros: Good discounts, some nice co workers
cons: Equipment not maintained, bad line management, store under staffed

title: ‘Not a very good experience working at Coles’
pros: Unfortuneltly there is not much good to tell

title: ‘A wonderful, friendly experience.’
pros: Dynamic,  supportive environment
cons: Difficult customers can make the role challenging at times.

title: ‘It was enjoyable, experiencing, challenging and it was a great week to stay away from school.’
pros: Nice Manager, he's awesome
cons: Trying to get used to their ways

title: ‘A good exprience in retail industry’
pros: The people you work with are great. Always friendly
cons: Customers as it is in every profession.

title: ‘Good pay for average work. ’
pros: Easy, mindless work. Nothing taxing
cons: Management are a joke couldn't organise a p'up in a brewery

title: ‘Helped me gain confidence with working with people and talking to customers’
pros: Everyone is very friendly and gets along. Feels like one big family.
cons: Learning new things and getting it right.

title: ‘Great team, bad culture’
pros: The people I work with
cons: Working in a company that see's you purely as a number that is completely disposable. HR very unsupportive and untrustworthy

title: ‘An experience I wouldn’t wish on my worst enemy’
pros: I would be lying if I said that I had a good experience
cons: Management change their mind daily

title: ‘Not too bad.’
pros: The other staff and most of the managers

title: ‘Don't regret working with Coles, it was great!!!’
pros:
Good environment
Friendly staff
Gives you Good opportunities for future development.
cons: No day is ever the same, there are always challenges to meet and have to think on your feet.

title: ‘Very mentally draining ’
pros: The team members themselves were good to work with most nights

title: ‘Management was poorly structured and bonuses weren’t tailored to each demographic. ’
pros: The customers were great and made the experience more enjoyable.
cons: Not being paid for the extra hours worked.

title: ‘Alot of effort for little pay’
pros: The other workers are generally friendly
cons: The pay is a disgrace

title: ‘It was great while it lasted’
pros: Nice friendly staff at shop level

title: ‘A fantastic job to kick start my working career.’
pros: Friendly, flexible, ability to gain experience in a number of departments.
cons: Workload/tasks are repetitive and can get boring.

title: ‘If you tired of your life join Coles’
pros: None as your reward for working hard is taken by  the top management
cons: Too much expectations from human beings and think you are robot or superman to complete the task

title: ‘Challenging but enjoys a challenge’
pros: Friendly staff great customers
cons: Staff rosterring difficult customers but was rewarding when keeping customers happy and wanting to come back with problems be resolved
location: Hallidays Point, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘They expect a lot from you and give very little in return.’
pros: The people that you meet while you are working
cons: Dealing with upper Management is a nightmare.

title: ‘Enjoyable, has bad bits like any job but i would recommend them’
pros: Always a good team enviroment
cons: Managers dont like you having sick days

title: ‘Very wonderful would recommend working for this wonderful company .’
pros: Very good company to work for and they have great team members to work with.

title: ‘Its okay job if you are a student’
pros: There are not many good things about Coles group. Greedy Corporate are ruining peoples life. Losing labor hours every quarters. I find only good things about that company the straight shifts to work.
cons: No break during shift

title: ‘Hard work is.never appreciated ’
pros: Customer service is the best part in this job.
cons: Too much biased environment as hiring is done on personal basis not on merit.

title: ‘Not bad, not great’

title: ‘Always there is more to learn and move forward.’

title: ‘Would not recommend’

title: ‘Fast-paced and eye opening world to work in.’
pros: Plenty of opportunities to make a difference.

title: ‘One big happy family’

title: ‘Easy to step in to’

title: ‘Work 60+ hour weeks for 40 hours of pay ’

cons: KPI’s are based off customer interactions
