title: ‘COLES IS BEST PLACE FOR PART TIMERS’
pros: Everyone is Treated equal
cons: Getting shifts if you are a casual employ

title: ‘A place for a career.’
pros: The right mix of management and team in a store can make it a phenomenal place to work. The company also really know how to look after team members going through a tough time or life events.
cons: It can be difficult while on salary to feel as if there is any work/life balance. It’s not always easy if you have a family or other commitments.

title: ‘Retail always ruined by poor management and taking advantage of employees.’
pros: Large roster with plenty of flexibility for students, part timers, casuals and the like. Majority of floor level staff are friendly and helpful.
cons: Managers do their best to suffocate and pressure employees. If you start feeling an injury coming on your better off quitting then and there, you won't get adequate or timely support. The constant rotation of managers also means you won't have very good references afterwards, since the people you worked with have left.

title: ‘Not just a number’
pros: The people make working here the best part, we are all like a family. Everyone knows everyone and we all enjoy working together as a store.
cons: Not enough staff and we always end up rushing around and it makes us look bad to our customers.

title: ‘Great team makes any challenges seem nothing’
pros: Built good friendship with colleagues as we do so many get together such as birthdays, special occassions and celebrating achievements both as individuals and as a store!
cons: As to any employers, they all have budgets they want to meet which sadly also means understaffing at most times.

title: ‘Great first job for kids or as a supplementary income in a household but unless you are in management it will not be enough to survive on with the cost of living increasing.’
pros: If you are looking for extra evening work as a second job and dont mind working weekends or short 3 hour shifts it can fit well
cons: Very difficult to increase your hours beyond 20 hours per week unless you are going into management. Company prefers smaller shifts so they dont need to give you breaks and prefer younger staff to keep their costs down.

title: ‘Good for a short term but way to chaotic for long term’
pros: I was always keen for additional hours and thanks to the poor management they needed some as flexible as I am. The people I worked with were great to chat but some didn't do the job at all so it was up to a few of us to get the job done.
cons:
Since I didn't have a single week as scheduled they ALWAYS messed up my pay.
I actually had to fight through 4 instances of Payroll Operations writing tens of emails to finally get everything sorted 3 months after my last day at work!

title: ‘Not worth the negative impact to personal mental/physical health, deterioration of personal & family life, with no gratitude for efforts & sacrifices; never again will I allow a company to treat me so poorly.’
pros: Train close by. Boosted sales 25% within 3 months.
cons: Zero work-life balance, no exaggeration, actually ZERO. Management not supportive, did not have a single coaching session or meeting during my time there. All issues were to be dealt with 'tomorrow' & same response the following day. 12-16hr days (leading to exhaustion) with complaints if you need a single day off.
location: West Ryde, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Challenging but worth it!!!’
pros: Love my hours and the regular customers that u get to talk with all the time who are very nice people to be around u and great team work from all our staff
cons: The lack of enough staff mostly days makes it very challenging and u have to run around trying to help ro everything to serving baskets running to help in kiosk then help in self serve then run back to registers all because the head guys don't want to pay for to many staff so we suffer trying to keep it altogether for them to make a profit they need enlightenment big time!!!!!

title: ‘After my injury I have ben lied to by Coles Managment and got no help’
pros: At the moment I have nothing good to say about Coles as I am being treated so poor and Coles as company is not being very supportive of me  after a work injury
cons: My challenge is getting management and head office to help me.

title: ‘Interesting and educational for those whose passion lies in supermarket’
pros: Great introduction into retail world which are applicable to other roles. Management has their challenges and in Coles, support system is on a high level.
cons: Peak/trough of retail sales means that challenges are just around the corner. as business goes through a quiet period, challenges grew and may affect work-life balance

title: ‘Wonderful to work for.’
pros: Coles have bean really good to me I broke my knee 3 weeks after I started and I was off work for nearly 8 months and they held my job for now I am off again having surgery on my knee and once again they are holding my job I think that it fantastic.
cons: No challenges

title: ‘Its great working with so many people but you are ultimately teased with opportunity thats beyond reach unless you live in the bosses back pocket.’
job_title: Fulltimer - Was Good Money, Part Timer - Okay Moneuly
pros: I loved my job and my colleague's were fantastic and that is what made me wants to progrees further however management was sometimes difficult to dealmwith if you weren't their favourite. I could see where I wanted to go but wasnt supported in getting there.
cons: Trying to achieve massive amounts of work in short timeframes. Sometimes rearranging an entire department takes longer than 10 minutes.

title: ‘My experience with Coles has been of great value.’
pros: The people, customers and staff make it all worthwhile.  The work is well set out and easy to follow. The focus on customers and team member safety is great, as is the procedure to have a well run, clean shopping environment.
cons: Getting work done within the allotted time frame can be very challenging at times, depending on which department you work in. The hours can make work life balance very difficult, especially when management makes changes to permanent rosters without any consultation from staff.  Management in some stores can be very reluctant to listen to experience from the staff on the shop floor.

title: ‘Overall a great place to work, most people who come to Coles never leave.’
pros: Great bunch of people and lots of work on all the time to keep busy.
cons: Competition is tough and sometimes decisions get made that impacts on employees even long-term loyal employees

title: ‘Simple work when not under the pressure of your supervisor's shadow. Guaranteed to be shouted at every shift for minor mistakes or not being fast enough.’
pros: Flexible rosters, simple work and friendly co-workers.
cons: Aggressive and sometimes unprofessional supervisors - micromanaging and always negative. Shifts offered the day of.

title: ‘Over all are good.’
pros: Alot of food for team member, often we ve party or  lunch together.
cons: Equal opportunity. Seem they give opportunity to new employees and young rather then to give it someone who worked longer who knows the job better. Sometimes need to speak up. And on line roster is not reliable and not ready to be seen in advance.

title: ‘A very good and enjoyable environment for a first job and even with past history. Overall, very welcoming and friendly.’
job_title: Casual Fruit And Veg Sales Person.
pros:
-Not much competition for applying for a job.
-Very good working environment.
-Many stores to work in and pick up extra hours.
-Midnight and Sunday rates.
cons:
-Very physical.
-Not taken into account of difference between positions. (E.g registers compared to fruit and veg).

title: ‘Life experience for young people’
pros: Hard work gets rewarded and there’s plenty or opportunity to go far in the business if that’s what you want, management do care about you too
cons: Satisfying management in terms of what they want from you, even if you are doing everything right

title: ‘Great opportunity, excellent team work’
pros: I work nightfill and i am a full time uni student and a mum so it works well with me. The team i work with are fantastic and we all try to help each other
cons: Sometimes communication gets lost down the line as we arent involved as much as the day staff

title: ‘Some of the staff were nice and some of my days were good.’
pros: The pay was quite good as well as the department managers. Shifts were given to me quite frequently so I could never complain about that. The department managers were also lenient and nice if I had to miss a shift due to a personal commitment.
cons: It was a very fast-paced and quick environment, some days there was no time to be slack.

title: ‘Friendly co-workers, customers and a generally fantastic work environment!’
pros: I loved working with people in the public.  I worked in check out and I always enjoyed meeting new people and just having a friendly chat.
cons: Dealing with difficult customers was my weakness.  However you get those types of people in any job really.

title: ‘Woroing at a Coles supermarket is great’
pros: The flexible hours and the people you work with. That there are many opportunities that come across that you can take.
cons: Some difficulties about working at Coles are some customers that you recover and have to deal with

title: ‘Excellent role, very diverse and never a dull moment’
pros: The team, the location, the challenges and the constant striving to do better were great.
cons: Sometimes the constant changes were too much. I believe change is great but when changes are made they are of a very grand scale and take a little time adjusting to.

title: ‘Stress-free and flexible! Perfect if you're studying.’
pros:
Team environment
Flexible hours, within the one department I have worked both early mornings through to days, and afternoons through to nights
cons: Customer service can be a challenge sometimes if they are unhappy

title: ‘Many years . Too much experience  ,hiding  on a shelf .’
pros: Friends l have made.You get to move around on the registers and do different jobs all the time not stuck in one place all the time.
cons: Coming back to work after l had  a accident and was  on leave without pay for 2 years . Was very challenging .everything had changed even me .

title: ‘Great people to work with and wonderfull customers’
pros: Great people to work with, all so nice and friendly. The manager allways checks in on how you are going and allways encourages you to do your best. Get to see regular customers and get to know them, as well as a great working environment.
cons:
Sometimes in Deli you will not get payed if you have to work longer than your contracted hours, because you have to clean everything but the deli only shuts at 9.
You have to be very time concious and be very pro active. But that just makes for a fast fun environment.

title: ‘Learnt how to speak to people, Customer Service at its best!’
pros: The best thing working at Coles was being recognised for your work. It motivates you to do better, and acknowledgement is a very important part of being happy at work.
cons: I was a service supervisor, and I really cant say there was too many challenging situations. The management system was good.

title: ‘Only a business to be apart of if in need of employment. Longevity depends on individual experience. ’
pros: Brand to put on a CV. Do encounter nice customers that are understanding every now and then.
cons: Dealing with rude aggresive customers which are highly common. Really effects working mentality.

title: ‘It's a tough place to work as they make you do three peoples job’
pros: The perks and the pay that's equal to the Australian standards
cons: It's getting weirder to work here than I joined in 2013.they are cutting the number of persons working in a short and making us to do 3 peoples job.no unions or SDA is strong and it's getting terrible to work there.

title: ‘Excellent opportunities for career development, they look after their staff and provide great training and stable employment.’
pros: Being a large company in the public eye, they are careful to treat their staff well. They offer plenty of training and opportunities for career development arise regularly.
cons: Some 5am starts and during peak times 9pm finishes  (obviously these two times would not be in one shift), and weekend work.

title: ‘Temporary’
pros: Not a difficult job mentally. Physically demanding, but not many responsibilities.
cons: Working with demanding bosses and members of the in-club who did not pull their weight. Guys get given the heavy lifting to do, while others do the lighter work. Thus wrecking your body while others get it easy. It is unfair to ask more of those who work the hardest.

title: ‘Work hard and you can achieve!’
pros: Lots of opportunity to work in alot of different deparments and learn many different things! They do help you to reach you goals.  There is always many people to ask for help.
cons: Working hard and being always available.

title: ‘Great employer - lots of opportunities.’
pros: My colleagues and understanding of management re life outside of work.
cons: Physical work was hard however mostly management understood that and so it made the challenges worth while.

title: ‘The years have seen a decline in rostered hours and increased work load resulting in workplace dissatisfaction. Generally morale is poor.’
pros: The customers are mostly nice and the team I work with are very good.
cons: Change is very difficult. Management is controlled by numbers from area managers which makes times difficult. Cost cutting resulting in less detail given to tasks, OHS issues and reductions in staffing numbers and same amount of work expected to be done.

title: ‘Unfortunately, working at Coles took up a significant part of my life, of which I will never get that time back.’
pros: There are some good benefits and perks when working at the Coles head office. There are some excellent people to work with as well.
cons: There is an expectation of a minimum 40 hour week (often 45+ hours per week), with no paid overtime (unless agreed with your manager prior to commencing overtime). The Coles head office isn't easily accessible via public transport, that is, unless you happen to live somewhere along the Glen Waverley train line or can catch a bus along Tooronga Road.

title: ‘I have met some of the worst and best people at Coles.’
pros: Good store culture. Everyone feels comfortable with saying hello and a quick chat with everyone else, regardless of what department you are from.
cons: Often mismanaged. Coles seems to promote people who aren't the best at their job. So while the staff are great, the managers are often slightly lackluster.

title: ‘Job is good’
job_title: The Work Is Good But Hit And Miss Management And Limited Opportunities.
pros: Good work life balance, interesting work (delivery driver), spend a lot of time out of the store on deliveries. Discounts on groceries. Some overtime available.
cons: Management rotates between stores so you can start with good managers and then get terrible managers. Virtually no career development opportunities. Not enough hours, management keep hiring new people whenever more hours become available instead of giving them to their main workers so hard to make any progression at all.

title: ‘Glad to have left’
pros: Work life balance is decent, I found my managers to usually be accomodating
cons: The managers. Especially the higher up ones just don’t care about their staff. There is also never enough hours, after seven years I was still a casual and would usually get less than 10 hours a week.

title: ‘Knowledge that I can take to any other business and apply to any future position whether it be with the business or elsewhere.’
pros: Being able to constantly develop and move up in the business, being able to learn several departments and gaining knowledge and expertise!
cons: Meeting the KPIs, consistently being challenged to deliver results and provide 100% customer satisfaction. Delivering business standards.

title: ‘A great first job that helped me develop professional and interpersonal skills that I still use today.’
pros: Flexible shifts to suit personal needs, great team to work with, lots of training, received discount card as benefit
cons: Meticulous with uniforms and personal appearance, felt a bit stifled that I could not display my individuality.

title: ‘Definitely an experience.’
pros: I like working with the people here. My fellow workers are nice and you feel like you are working in a mini family. There is always something you can talk about and an opportunity to make new friends even though people may come and go.
cons: Work is always hard and ongoing. Dealing with customers can be quite challenging and difficult at some times. Each department has its own perks and challenges. If you work in a couple of departments you need to be flexible.

title: ‘A good fulfilling job to make a living where positives usually outweigh the negatives’
pros: Flexible hours and work with great people, build skills and make friends.
cons: Management asking too much of employees, poor rostering and neglecting apparent issues.

title: ‘Loved working there, would love to go back.’
pros: Many chances to develop and be cross trained, great team environment at store level, a lot of roles to achieve and \"move up\" and great place to be able to juggle all life commitments eg: children, education etc...
cons: Hard to develop your career past store level, senior management only promotes if you are \"known\".

title: ‘It definitely boosted the self confidence and knowledge towards customer service which is the foremost responsibility of any retail field.’
pros:
Working with a great team and management
Working under extreme pressure 
Time management
cons: Facing the customers is definitely the most vital challenge i face. Dealing with different customers having different temperament at time could be very tricky.

title: ‘I enjoyed being a valued team member in a busy supermarket environment.’
pros:
The salary is definitely better than independent supermarkets.
Work, Health and safety issues and training are taken seriously.
cons:
Despite originally being employed by Coles before being taken over by an independent supermarket 7 years ago, all efforts to be re-employed by Coles in recent years have been rejected.
 I have vast experience and happen to be over 50 years old, so that is disappointing as I consider myself a hardworking employee.

title: ‘Great pay but is it worth it?’
pros: Coles helps you advance your career and pays extremely well for its salaried employees. If you work hard you get opportunity
cons: For salaried people, 12 hour days are Common and often days are longer than that again. You must be happy being at work early in the morning and late at night, overnight are common too. Little regard is given to academic qualifications. You need to be able to self promote and talk a good game, this is often more important than actual skills.

title: ‘Good place to start when beginning to work.’
pros: Good for students who just want to earn some money on the side as it pays pretty well.  Not much of a learning curve get the hang of the jobs pretty quickly.
cons: Having to make time for work, as I was on call and so you would receive a call to work 2-3hrs before they want you to start work.

title: ‘Horrible’
pros: There were a large amount of enthusiastic and happy staff members. It provided a basis for skill development, such as customer service, communication, management, etc.
cons: Working with close minded management - There was a lot of negative comments made about customers, abuse of other staff members. I wasn't presented with an opportunity for career development - after 3 years and at the ago of 22 I was still casually employed and struggling. Management would not move me to part time or present me sigh equality or stability even after I proved long term commitment. I was also refused my right to resign - fair trading had been contacted on a regular basis.
location: Mount Druitt, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Working at Coles has it's ups and downs’
pros:
Meet interesting customers
Make good friendships with coworkers
Sometimes theres a fun and jolly work atmosphere
It is good for building up any basic knowledge and experience
cons:
- not a team based structured workplace
- communication about ongoings is not clear with all employees

title: ‘Great environment, great co-workers and great customers’
pros: The working environment is fantastic with a great mix of personalities
cons: The work is great, trying to understand the customers with the many nationalities that shop at our store, is a bit of a challenge, but I thoroughly enjoy being able to assist them with their inquiries.

title: ‘Good job good money’
pros: Highly paid and physically demanding fast pace but nice benefits like a coles discount card
cons: Demanding and have to work shifts around the clock

title: ‘I would be happy to work there if I didn't want a career in Plumbing.’
pros: Great People, Great environment
cons: Honestly nothing if you cant manage there its you not the company

title: ‘Hard work but really enjoying it so far!’
pros:
As a delivery driver, I get to be out on the road, enjoy the weather and listen to my own tunes.
Everyone helps each other and it's a great atmosphere.
cons: Working in the rain or heat can be difficult.

title: ‘S’alright.’
pros: The team are all generally friendly. Pay was never late and my tasks were always clear and achievable. We got some pretty nice perks such as discounts on products and services such as phone plans and holidays.
cons:
Management could be challenging to work with. There seemed to be this impression that everyone working with the company were looking for any and every opportunity to not do their work, which could be demoralising.

I also got hurt at work and couldn’t work out where to report it.

title: ‘My experience at Coles has been incredible’
pros: Working with an amazing group of people, the customers who are absolutely lovely and appreciative make it so worth it, also your regular customers who you soon get a bond with.
cons: Busy season(Christmas) and difficult customers, it can sometimes be quite confronting and challenging

title: ‘In the 17 years I worked there, I felt like I was always moving upward.’
pros: There is a wealth of experience to draw from and plenty of opportunity to move around.
cons: Margins are always kept low, so too are the wages.

title: ‘Really good’
pros: You can work flexibly between multiple departments and can gain a wide range of skills. Penalty rates apply for sundays, and you get a 5% discount at Coles related stores.
cons: It is advised going part-time as some departments rarely give casual workers shifts.

title: ‘Enables great balance between family, work and studies.’
pros: The most important thing in my life is flexibility. This means i can juggle life and work. My roster revolves around me and not the other way around.
cons: Luck of developmental programs.

title: ‘Average’
pros: There weren't many good things about working there. I found interacting with customers was the best
cons: Dealing with unsatisfied customers, supervisors who didn't like you and being on your feet for hours on end. Having to work 5 hours to get a 15 minute break

title: ‘Been more than 5 years already but recently with the overhauling of management, opportunities are running out.’
pros: It is a large corporate so lots of internal opportunities.
cons: Since it is a large corporate, IT Systems are now in the verge of un-maintainability and most of it are becoming legacy. Doing quality automations on application systems are almost quite impossible. If you're looking for things like AWS, SaaS, Cloud Computing, you rarely experience that here.

title: ‘Good at the start and a great first job.’
pros: I love the people I worked with and most of them were lovely.
cons: Standing in one spot on your feet all day doing the same thing is hard and also dealing with very difficult customers can kinda suck. I left because a new manager came in and forced me to quit.

title: ‘Easy work, but out of touch management.’
pros: Relatively easy work - low stress unless you have useless co-workers who you have to cover for, or worker harder because of.
cons: Management don't care about you unless you screw up

title: ‘A positive entry into the workforce.’
pros: It was an extremely supportive environment with excellent training. I always had a lot of fun and enjoyed the opportunity to work in different departments.
cons: In every industry you have difficult customers, other than that I don't think there were too many challenges.

title: ‘Listen to staff and practice what you preach’
pros: Loyalty discount, Great bunch of employees  mostly but the management have either just come out of school or should retire.
cons: Management would not listen to constructive criticism and they treated me like a child.  I had over 20 years in retail although they didn't care about my opinions

title: ‘I love working for coles’
pros: Ability to sit down with manager to work out a contract that allows a good balance between home and work. Discount card
cons: The only challengers that i find is the ones i place on myself. Coles has been very supportive in  my time of needs

title: ‘It is a great job for me as a student as I am a valued team member and can still balance it with my other commitments.’
pros: Hard work is rewarded, my manager will give me shifts because she knows I work hard in them and do as I am trained.
cons: Working at different stores can be challenging, because not all of them are at the same level. My primary store is the best of 3 stores that I have worked at.

title: ‘Working with Coles was an interesting, memorable and fulfilling experience in itself.’
pros: Working with the well-known company gives you good knowledge and sound experience in retail industry and future customer focused opportunities in your job search. Good habit of teamwork and time management at the workplace.
cons: To approach and communicate with management officials for advice. To get information about career progression within the company. To share and exchange ideas with team leaders and members.

title: ‘Don’t work for Coles management team, it’ll be your end.’
pros: It’s a well known company and have been a company I’ve worked for for over 20 years, you’ll find the right manager and connect with them and you’ll be fine.
cons: Working with the wrong management team, young, inexperienced, and high achievers who is not able to produce results pushing you to breaking point.

title: ‘The opportunity to assist customers find products, contributing to store hygiene, amenity and presentation.’
pros: The opportunity to assist customers find products, contributing to store hygiene, amenity and presentation.
cons: The opportunity to assist customers find products, contributing to store hygiene, amenity and presentation.

title: ‘Great place to work and everyone do care for eachother which is good and it motivates to work.’
pros: All the teammembers are helpful and you can share your experiences with your team which is beneficial for everyone.
cons: To deal aggressive customers sometimes is a challenge because they don't listen to us so, we have to call store manger yo resolve the problem.

title: ‘Can be great if you really force yourself to like it’
pros: There is room to develope a career with Coles if you really apply yourself to it.
cons: Head office has no idea how stores actually run and unless you get a good manager a store can become a terrible place to work very very quick.

title: ‘Great first job, or in interested in a long career.’
pros: Stable employment, opportunities for career enhancement, opportunities to learn and grow both personally and professionally.
cons: Challenging customers, having to remember a lot of different things, keeping calm under stress/difficult situations; making a mistake that only  a manager can fix, trying to keep all customers happy.,

title: ‘Overall this is a pysical but rewarding Job.’
pros: As a driver, Im out on my own, and each customer I deliver to  WANTS me to be there.  This makes for a good experience.
cons: The weather.  It can be physically demanding so basic fitness is needed.  Lots of lifting.

title: ‘Coles is a great company to work for with many employee benefits’
pros: Good work environment with respectful managers
cons: Morally hard to see the amount of plastic that is used in packaging (when I was doing nightfill) and unsure if it is being recycled properly

title:
‘Was one of my first jobs, stayed for 2 years or so and it was honestly better than i initially thought it would be 
However depends on the environment of workers around you ’
pros:
Positive team and environment 
Laidback however organised so its not stressful
cons: Customers maninly, and only small irritable stock, shelving or order issues

title: ‘Enjoyable  working with a great bunch of people.’
pros: Fixed hours great people to work with  working for a progressive company with possibilities to get to a management position
cons: Trying to arrange a work life balance with family study and work .also the wage could be a little bit higher.

title: ‘I have worked in worse places :) but it pays the bills’
job_title: Retail Assist And All Rounder( Work In All Departments)
pros:
Come across great people to work with and customers. 
There are also a variety of positions that can be worked and keeps it great as a learning curb.
cons:
Too try and work up the ranks to what u would like to achieve.
Trying to get more support to help u achieve ur goals within a timely manner.
As a single mum I find it hard to try and get an understanding of family work and life balance, yet I believe I work extra hard to be one who wants to achieve goals.

title: ‘Great experience, excellent work life balance’
pros: Great team environment, excellent work life balance
cons: No real issues, except some late finishes like 9pm on Saturday nights, but it balances out...

title: ‘An intersting insight to a large comapny, but bad culture permeates through all areas.’
pros:
There are good people here doing good work. The supermarket space is tough with Coles setting some unrealistic goals.
Good events in Stores Support Centre,  Good wage
cons:
Poor Line Management, ZERO training, All managers only interested in their KPI to get a bonus, regardless of if it's the business best interests or not.
The company is too hung up on customer feedback and will constantly change (almost weekly) to accomodate, even if this feedback is conflicting (which it often is).

A sucession of very poor marketing campaigns have hurt the company image.

title: ‘Overall, i enjoy working with my team and managers’
pros: Great team, flexible hours
cons:
Putting a lot of effort in what you do but don't get acknowledge for it. 
there are favourites in the store that always getting \"caring passionately award\". But these people don't do much. 
I put my heart and soul when i do my work but only been rewarded once or twice in the 10 years that i have worked in this company.

title: ‘Overall I had a good experience at Coles! You just cant let the little stuff get to you, always be positive especially around the people you work with!’
pros: Becoming friends with the people you work with (incl everyone throughout the store)
cons:
Customers coming to you with an annoyed attitude about a product in the store
Managers being stressed from store management/2IC's (especially over holiday periods!)

title: ‘Good company. Serious and reliable. Coles gives possibility to everyone with or without experience to show what a person is capable of. 100% recommended!’
pros:
Good rates if working outside normal hours or weekends.
good team and very easy going
cons: Sometimes the management is absent and some co-workers take advantage of this.
location: Bondi Junction Nuovo Galles del Sud, Australia

title: ‘Lost its way ’
pros: I was paid well,but had to work hard for it. Close to home, A lot of friendly team members.
cons: A lot of team members flaunt the regulations and take many sick days.majority of upper mgmt arn't leaders and make poor or no critical decisions.a national office that make most decisions ,but it is in total disconnect from reality.

title: ‘Decent job but no understanding from management and rarely action taken for problems ’
pros: Getting to be involved in various aspects of running a store and positively influencing the community's experience. Teamwork and special themed days were highlights.
cons: Lots of understaffing and a lack of HR support. We were always only just getting by when we could have been much better off. Management never understood what it was like on the floor.

title: ‘OK, not bad, transferred to big store but get less work than small store’
pros: Discounts on fuel and food, my team members are great, trained in various departments, no day or week ever the same, good workplace relationships, raise money for fund raisers, recognition for hard work and being dedicated to your job, opportunity to take on extra responsibility if needed
cons: 4 hour shifts 3 times a week, 12 hours a week and cannot increase my contract or get work with other coles or related stores, constant cutting of shifts and team members making replenishment and customer service very difficult, other team members in the store don't pull their weight or contribute to team effectiveness, woeful work-life balance and constant calling to come in early immediately and pressured to say yes, their training program to progress careers isn't available and trained too many people in total for the number of positions available, working late hours

title: ‘Great Organisation to work in, friendly and supportive staff. ’
pros: Workplace culture is highly recognised within the Organisation. Making Sydney Catholic Schools a unique organisation for people to work in.
cons: Many roles to recruit, which is easily turned around by positive and rewarding outcomes in the end.

title: ‘Good till it’s not’
pros: If your good at your role and want to step up in the company there is a lot of opportunity, good team environment
cons: Worked to the bone, the higher up the ladder you go the more time they take from you, forget having a life coles is your life now

title: ‘Excellent workplace with a good pay.’
pros: Always a great team to work with and the pay is quite good for retail.
cons: Can be difficult to get extra hours and full time work. They hire a lot of teenagers and school kids to work instead of getting the older staff to do the hours.

title: ‘Very hard to deal with, stressful, not flexible and poorly organised.’
pros: Having a good uniform that isn't sexualised or restricting, it's easy to keep clean and move around in.
cons: COMMUNICATION!!! PLEASE BE AWARE COMMUNICATION IN THE SERVICE DEPARTMENT IS DISGUSTING AND FRUSTRATING!

title: ‘Pretty average’
pros: Experience was great
cons: Management was difficult

title: ‘I wouldn't recommend working here’
pros: The people you work with can be amazing and some of the customers make your day.
cons: Management changes constantly and with that it's new ways to do things that is never actually explained to you. It's a very high school gossipy environment no matter what store you are at. No support when customers harrass you.

title: ‘It’s good for uni days , don’t make career out of it. Even the higher managers complained and followed vague policies and long hours with less pay structure.’
pros: Diversity and you get to know a lot about others, their culture etc etc
cons: Every single person I met used to complain and still chose to work there. Motivating staff to finish work and follow protocols and procedures was hardest, as they were there to finish 3 hrs. Management was too busy playing favourites game and institutionalised pulling was at peak. It did taught me I can do better with better opportunities, package and work life balance. So I called quits, didn’t even bother to utilise my many hours of sick , just gave notice of month and left .

title: ‘Night fill, very enjoyable ’
pros: The people you work with
cons: Time , everything had to be completed by end of shift.  And sometimes there wasn’t enough time to do so.

title: ‘Us this as a gateway job, don't choose a career.’
pros: Worked with great co workers.
cons: Management who didn't know what they were doing, so much put on each employee, to much wage saving, cutting staff.

title: ‘Can be fun but...’
job_title: I Worked In Many Departments And Many Stores
pros: I worked with some amazing people, we laughed, we cried, we had dinners out regularly. The majority of people were wonderful to be around.
cons: Upper management seemed to have a problem with me enjoying my job, always looking down their noses at me. If you work well its more likely you will get stuck in the one job and not move around much. Great team members often get cranky with managements attitude and move away into other jobs. The terrible workers often stay around and get the management training and thus continue the tradition of having bad, incompetent managers in key rolls.

title: ‘Unrewarding’
pros: Job security. No qualification needed.
cons: Purely a money focused company. No consideration for anything else.

title: ‘Better than no job’
pros: Good people to work with
cons: The heat, getting store up to standard

title: ‘Good pay not much else’
pros: Decent wage as a driver, easy job, staff discount
cons: Bad management, poor communication, un-realistic bureaucracy, over corporate,  bad rostering, no career development possibility.

title: ‘Long hours hard work for little reward. Work life balance is next to impossible for anyone on salary working in store operations’
pros: Team environment, customer focused and the business puts a lot of effort into diversity. Although sometimes to it's detriment
cons: Trying to achieve a profit and a standard with increased focus on lower prices and efficiencies. Whilst watching \"support\" functions increase exponentially

title: ‘Fast paced, dynamic with a focus on delivering results’
pros: Customer focus, large complete organisation, lots of potential to be great
cons: Stakeholder engagement

title: ‘Great place if it's been managed well with work / life balance.’
pros:
Good benefits since in remote location. 
Multi cultural
cons:
Less staff for a bigger work load.
Recruitment.

title: ‘Flexible work hours.’
pros:
- Flexible work hours
- Great colleagues
- 10% discount at Christmas is handy
cons: Understaffed at times. Low hourly rate for staff on contracts.

title: ‘Horrible inexperienced managers’
pros: Pleasant colleagues that made the job bearable
cons: Inexperienced managers

title: ‘Would never go back.’
pros: The team members were good to manage
cons:
Not enough staff rostered.
Inconsistent management

title: ‘Great job, great people, not career ideal.’
pros: Team is great, very aware of others and very helpful. Regular customers are awesome
cons:
Bandaiding problem areas, as if they are going to fix them selves. Some tasks from higher up seem a bit impossible with real life situations / areas. 
Not enough hours to create full time jobs.

title: ‘It's just a job and it barely paid the bills, it's a long process to climb the ladder so be prepared to put up with a lot if you want a career here.’
pros: The work is fairly simple and straightforward
cons: Getting enough hours/pay

title: ‘Terribly stressful and absolutely appalling management.’
pros: I occasionally got the time off that I needed.
cons: Everything to do with the job. Way too much responsibility for everyone.

title: ‘1and half years’
pros: For mums, its good to work with school kids. Environment is very good if you have good supervisor.
cons:
Same work whole shift.
4hour shift with no break

title: ‘Friendly team members, good money and opportunities to get in different appartments.’
job_title: Night Filler, Cashier, Dairy Rotator And Trolley Boy
pros: There's always something different to do.
cons: Remembering which isles hold what products. Otherwise it's pretty easy.

title: ‘Friendly good pay work’
pros:
Weekend pay 
Pick your hours 
Friendly staff 
Make friends easily 
Beibg able to help the elderly/ disabled and giving thema chance to talk about their lives makes them happy which makes me happy
cons:
On feet for hours 
Twisting and lifting

title: ‘Would do it again ’
pros: Compatible hours for family
cons: Driving to better yourself

title: ‘Bad management from multiple stores and very bad hours.’
pros: Pay was alright, 5% discount helped.
cons: Dealing with managers, Getting more hours per week, Waking up at midnight for 4 hours of work.

title: ‘Was good’
pros: The group of people i worked with in nightfil
cons: Just keeping up with the fast pase. Especially when the delivery trucks were late

title: ‘Loved my job, foubd it hard to juggle my children with the demands of the job’
pros: The customers
cons: Store targets

title: ‘Overal good comapny to work for.’
pros: Foundation of Retail, L&D, Security
cons: Work life balance was challanging

title: ‘Definitely won’t work there unless I know the culture has changed’
pros: You developed good relationships with other team members and colleagues  around you
cons: No work life balance and the culture at store level is very toxic as you can’t really trust upper management (do as they say and not as they do). There’s no integrity in terms of reporting.

title: ‘Would be a great place to work if management actually cared.’
pros: Decent hourly rate, guaranteed hours (as a part timer). Not particularly dangerous work, friendly co-workers (mostly).
cons: Poor time management from the upper bosses trickles down and makes life very difficult for us. We can almost never get our work done in the time allotted. Oftentimes certain roles won't be filled if someone calls in sick, which means that those who are working have to try and do multiple jobs at once sometimes.

title: ‘Apply for woolies,they have in invested in infrastructure. The talent pool is slowly dwindling at coles.’
pros: Some of the team are great to work with and get the work done.
cons: Most of the team are unskilled and never trained and are a nightmare to work beside

title: ‘Absolutely a disastrous experience’
pros: None to mention there is nothing good to say
cons: Dealing with self centered managers

title: ‘Fantastic work experience with good people’
pros: The people you work with and the staff as well as the hours and wage
cons: Suitable work days for myself as well as good hours to suit for me.

title: ‘It was the worst working environment I’ve ever experienced.’
pros: Nothing, I absolutely hated it.
cons: Everything, including dealing with other workers.

title: ‘Zero’
pros: The friends you make.
cons:
They expect blood and pay peanuts
It's a 12 hour a day job, that's standard expectation from management

title: ‘A job that I left with fond memories’
pros:
Small but friendly team. 
Great work life balance.
cons: Changing work/project priority on the flight.

title: ‘Coles has always been there through all my life changes, highschool, college, 2nd job, building a family and continues to back me 100% now’
pros: It's like having a big extended family
cons: To learn new things and get better results

title: ‘Average’
pros: Good if its ur first job
cons: Managers sometimes can be a bit difficult

title: ‘Physically demanding’
pros: Good work/life balance
cons: Customers, management

title: ‘You can dedicate yourself to this company and always be available to work, but your efforts won't be noticed. ’
pros: 5% staff discount comes in handy.
cons: The pay is ok but it's no use when they only contract you for minimum hours. They don't care if it's your only source of income. No opportunity for advancement.

title: ‘Would never work here ever again!!’
pros: Some of the people were great to work with.
cons: Extremely Toxic Environment. Too many politics.

title: ‘I now have permenant back pain and a complete distrust for supermarket practices’

cons: Too many chiefs and not enough Indians. Too many hidden oh&s issues that they like to hide and deny

title: ‘A great base to learn about yourself’
pros: Flexible hours, people I work with
cons: The customers at times, communication between departments

title: ‘A great place for anybody to w’

cons: Repetitive tasks

title: ‘Was a good job but they could make it better.’

cons: The company would expect you to go out of your way for them, but would not do the same for employees.

title: ‘Awesome’
pros: You can easily balance  your personal and professional life,Which is great.

title: ‘Working at Coles supermarkets was the worst experience in my life and I will never step in their store again’

cons: Trolley collecting was very challenging although.......I did love my role

title: ‘Good experiences but not happy with hr team  they need to be reviewed ’
pros: It was good at the start but the last 3 years I was there hr knew what was happening about been picked on nothing got  done about it then hr making up stories that customers complained about me what a load of hog wash why would I say something if I valued my job I had no support from Coles just pointing the finger
cons: It was good challenges to achieve where you wanted to be

title: ‘Been great having been given a chance to serve the people at coles’

cons: Regular change of programme on hours of work.

title: ‘Would not recommend’

cons: Work life balance is non existent in Coles and you never feel as though you can do anything right.

title: ‘Great if not for management’
pros: People I worked with and helping the public

title: ‘Focus on equal opportunity...’

title: ‘Made friends for life’

Loved most of my colleagues and managers/supervisors

title: ‘Great place to start but not stay for long.’

title: ‘Long hours poor life balance’

title: ‘Good experience’

title: ‘Make great friends, have fun! But a waste of time otherwise.’
pros: Met some of my best friends working here. You will love your work colleagues and have fun with them.
cons: Management always changing rules and not communicating, then blaming employees. Customers are mostly horrible.

title: ‘My experience has not been good...’

title: ‘Good first job to get you going.’
pros:
As a casual you can just ask for the days off you need. Management is happy to answer questions. 
Pay is pretty good on weekends.
cons:
You might get thrown in the deep end when you start working. If you are the sort of person who learns best while doing you’ll be fine and don’t be afraid to ask questions.

You might not get many shifts as a casual and work will be inconsistent.

title: ‘Terrible management!’
pros: Nothing unless your full time, but we don’t employ anymore we have APS recruitment and they’re expected to do 15% extra than us for less money
cons: To become full time, we have casuals who have been there 5 years and still not full time

title: ‘Horrible, wouldn’t recommend them to anyone. ’

cons: Everything. Nothing is easy there! They make everything hard.

title: ‘Loved working there’

title: ‘Unpleasant’

title: ‘I work with a great team’

title: ‘Great place to work whilst studying’

title: ‘You just become a number in a large company’

title: ‘Its close to home, customers are generally very friendly’
pros: Meeting new people every day

title: ‘It's ok i reckon.’

title: ‘Great whilst I still worked there but have also just been made redundant’
pros: The friendships I built while working there for 20 years
cons: Workload expected is quite large and especially with the re structure  and redundancies people are expected to take on so much more work above their own workload.

title: ‘Good if it is your last option.’
pros: Coles allows you to have flexible hours while in uni/school.
cons: The higher up you go in the hierarchy, the worse the people are. Budget gets cut constantly and then pressure is put on staff to maintain standards (which is impossible when under staffed). Company cares way too much about lining its own pockets rather than investing in stores and their staff, which is why Coles are continuing to lose money and will close down within the next 10 or so years.

title: ‘Average’
pros: Fun job and have made life long friends working there.

title: ‘Not on my recommend list of employers.’

title: ‘Rewarding’

cons:
Far to many emails.
far too much middle mgmt interference

title: ‘Good to help friendly customers, and work strong as a team’
pros: Friendly customers, helping people, keeping busy, helpful team.
cons: Pressure when rushed, angry customers.Trying to do several jobs at once.

title: ‘Money making machine with no regard for it's team members.’
pros: Team discount which is doubled at Christmas time.
cons: Initiatives introduced which have been thought up by someone who sits at a desk and has no idea how practical or impractical initiatives might be. Customers take out any anger on the staff at the coalface not the people behind the desk in Head Office.

title: ‘Average Job But Pays the Bills’
pros:
- Simple job working on registers
- 5% discount on groceries, 5% discount also applies at Kmart, Target and other Coles group stores
cons:
- Very repetitive
- Have to pay for uniforms even if it it is ruined at work or if you want more than one
- If you are casual like myself and friends, they continuously push for you to be on a part time contract despite the fact you go to uni full time and have other commitments (Coles nation wide are trying to drastically minimise the amount of casuals they have employed)
- If something comes up you can't give any less than 2 weeks notice
- Working on registers can bring a lot of pain to the back, shoulders and wrists

title: ‘After 16 years I’m ready for a change. I have a 3 year old and I feel he doesn’t get adequate time with me.’
pros: Working some great people. Moving from store to store you get to meet a lot of people.
cons: Work life balance. As a manager you are expected to work long days.

title: ‘Wonderful employment experience ’
pros: Meet new customers all the time, the great discount on airfares, groceries etc
cons: Making sure you get your work completed especially when customers ask where a product is etc and you are unsure

title: ‘Quit Coles, if u can get better(9 to 5) jobs.’
pros: Step up opportunities are plenty
cons: To stand on your feet all the time.

title: ‘Diverse, challenging and supportive company that gives many rewards and sense of teamwork’
pros: Very flexible with rosters, good feedback from managers, regular training days, good pay for an unskilled person.
cons: Working when everyone else has the day off, Keeping up with the pace at times

title: ‘I worked there for nearly 8 years during high school and uni, enjoyed it a lot most of the time.’
pros: Flexible working hours, great co-workers
cons: When you have a bad manager it’s really bad!

title: ‘I enjoyed my 2 years at Coles and believe I did a good job and worked as hard as I could’
pros: I loved the communication between the customers and staff
cons: My Front end Manager was not a nice person and a lot of good staff left because of her. The Managers we had knew of the problem but nothing could be done.

title: ‘Poor working experience’
pros: The casual pay is fairly good not so much for the part-time, full-time workers.
cons: Very demanding and a lot of contact in personal hours. Management can be quite rude even in front of customers on the floor. Overworked and insufficiently staffed. No room to advance within company, even to extent of stopping contracting people past casual. The last person advancing to part-time contract was 2 years ago despite individuals working many hours a week consistently over months to years. Not a job that offers healthy lifestyle balance.

title: ‘The experience was sure a journey and it was a great one.’
pros:
Team work.
Friendly, joyful and great environment.
Great members.
cons: Keeping up with work while helping team members and customers.

title: ‘The opportunities that have allowed me to be where I am today.’
pros: Satisfaction of progression and the ability to help forward progression of teams.

title: ‘Good foot in the door company, not so good career choice’

cons:
Management are not understanding or proffessional in many cases. Not caring about fixing issues or problems but caring more about sales and themselves rather than their staff which can effect staff moral.
 it can be an overly demanding workload at times and from my experience many managers are not trained enough in people skills and service.

title: ‘Overall bad’

title: ‘Good first time job as well as for students looking to work while studying as well as people looking to further their career opportunities!’
pros: Pay is ok for just you average retail job. Sunday overtime rates. Working in a ariconditiones environment.

title: ‘If only guaranteed hours were given’
pros: Great hourly rate of pay

title: ‘Would love to go back now the manager has been moved on’
pros: The regular customers

title: ‘Just don't do it to yourself, unless you've got no other option.’
pros: My regular customers. When on the registers I often have a line up of people waiting to be served by myself rather than others. Makes you feel appreciated. Sunday rates are really good as well. They provide fruit most days of the week in the staff room, and occasionally baked goods too. These are often over ripe, blemished or burnt though. Being many different personalities, you often find people you get a long well with.
cons: Managers often weren't interested in following own company guidelines or OHS. They would pressure you to work additional hours, not taking no for an answer, calling every day off to ask if you could come in for shifts. Stock takes were often held anywhere from 11 pm til 6 am. Not enough staff hour allocation, so you were often the only one on register or shop floor, which makes for very unhappy customers. Customers hound you on arrival and up until you get in your car, as there is no one else available. Too many bosses with different ideas of how things should be done, demanding you do one task three different ways. Then when you need the bosses, you often can't get in contact with them. Shift managers that aren't properly trained are a definite problem. We got a pay cut too. Changing your permanent roster is a real hassle, management often try to con you into signing paperwork without you being able to read it. Store managers all seem to lack any basic communication skills or manners, unless talking to customers or higher ups. You get new store managers almost every year so everything changes a lot.

title: ‘Absolutely love my job’

Good team environment, often very supportive management,  often but not always. 

My
cons: I am a defence spouse.  In the past,  Coles was very supportive of transfers from one store or state to another, transferring part time hours within the company.  For my most recent move,  I lost my 8 years of sick/ personal leave and the ability to accrue shares through the company. The only position I was able to secure (after admin error after admin error) was a casual position... Still no option to reinstate my personal leave.  It leaves a bitter taste in an otherwise mostly positive 8 year career with the company

title: ‘Lots of potential lost due to poor management.’
pros: Coles gives a decent discount to multiple retailers, and great training that will give you lots of opportunities to be rostered in more than one department or store if that's what you would like.
cons: The management at Coles is a mess. In my experience store managers, department managers or even duty managers are swapped around more frequently than the weather changes. Because of this expectations and merchandising change all the time. There's also a lot of double handling, unclear direction and miscommunication. Ultimately it's the reason a lot of people leave and why I left. It's hard to deal with constant changing faces when you rely on leadership so much.

cons: If you're wanting to progress it takes long goes and hard work. Not uncommon to work 14+ hr days. Very little recognition for the work you do, expectations are far too unrealistic and executive management seem to have little knowledge of actual day to day running. Takes more than simple tasks as there is never a normal day or everything running to plan

title: ‘Don't work for Coles.’

cons:
Management are horrible, very poorly trained and rude to their workers.

Use Carton rates to determine hours which don't account for time with customers.

It sucks watching co-workers struggle with issues that are purely caused by under-staffing issues.
